types.section:
{{fr-noun|m}}

# a [[laborer]] working as part of an early [[Middle Age]] share [[cropping]] system known as ''[[complant]]'' - a precursor to the [[métayage]] system. Under this system, the ''prendeur'' would cultivate land owned by a [[bailleur]]. In exchange for using the ''bailleur's'' soil, the ''prendeur'' promised a share of the crop or its revenue. The length of this partnership varied and sometimes would extend over generations
types.html:
prendeur m (plural prendeurs)

  1. a laborer working as part of an early Middle Age share cropping system known as complant - a precursor to the métayage system. Under this system, the prendeur would cultivate land owned by a bailleur. In exchange for using the bailleur's soil, the prendeur promised a share of the crop or its revenue. The length of this partnership varied and sometimes would extend over generations
trans: a laborer working as part of an early Middle Age share cropping system known as complant - a precursor to the métayage system. Under this system, the prendeur would cultivate land owned by a bailleur. In exchange for using the bailleur's soil, the prendeur promised a share of the crop or its revenue. The length of this partnership varied and sometimes would extend over generations
